result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Poetker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Comply with any CHIPS orders.  Parenting classes per agent.  Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer L Poetker

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

11:35 AM Prosecuting attorney John Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer L Poetker in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Jennifer L Poetker. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense hands the court a signed plea form.  Court performs plea collquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters her plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  State is recommending a withheld sentence, 2 yr. probation with appropriate conditions.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  Defense asks the court to follow the recommendation.  Defendant speaks on her own behalf. 
Plea:
Ct. 1- NC
BTC:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, SENTENCE WITHHELD, 2 YR. PROBATION.

Eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Conditions:
Comply with any CHIPS orders.
Parenting classes. 
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.

8:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer L Poetker in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Jennifer L Poetker. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  The State has tendered an offer, defense has not explained the offer to the deft.  The court will need an update on the defendant's other cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer L Poetker in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan for Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Jennifer L Poetker. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  The State is asking for one more status.  The defendant has been sending letters to the court regarding bail modification/gps supervision and speedy trial demands.  The court is not aware if the attorney of record is aware of this.  The court believes the defendant has a hold as she was just sentenced by this court last year.  
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
